mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Eleanor Stuart to Tobias Lear, 1790 April 18
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Stuart, Eleanor Calvert Custis, approximately 1758-1811
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Eleanor Calvert Custis Stuart writes from Abingdon to Tobias Lear in New York about his approaching marriage--her unhappiness--had hoped to see her children this summer--her concern over Nelly--fears she will be spoiled by too much attention--"her Dear Grandmama is too much pleased with the attentions paid to Nelly to judge of their impropriety. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, docketed by Lear "April 12th 1790." Name on original manuscript appears as "Eleanor Stuart."
